prerequisites.fi: Recommended prerequisites: CHEM-E3190 and CHEM-E8120
prerequisites.sv: Recommended prerequisites: CHEM-E3190 and CHEM-E8120
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: CHEM-E3190 and CHEM-E8120

learningOutcomes.fi:
On completion of this course, the student will be able to:
  1. Associate the cellular structures of microorganisms with their roles in physiology.
  2. Explain microbial growth dynamics, discuss the associated cellular processes, and quantitatively assess population growth.
  3. Discuss the regulatory mechanisms of microorganisms and analyze them in terms of resource use and speed of adaptation.
  4. Examine diverse strategies of microorganisms to fulfil fundamental metabolic needs and analyze microbial metabolism using computational tools.
  5. Appraise the mechanisms of genomic changes in microbial cells and evolution.
  6. Discuss assessing microbial community composition and function.
learningOutcomes.sv:
On completion of this course, the student will be able to:
  1. Associate the cellular structures of microorganisms with their roles in physiology.
  2. Explain microbial growth dynamics, discuss the associated cellular processes, and quantitatively assess population growth.
  3. Discuss the regulatory mechanisms of microorganisms and analyze them in terms of resource use and speed of adaptation.
  4. Examine diverse strategies of microorganisms to fulfil fundamental metabolic needs and analyze microbial metabolism using computational tools.
  5. Appraise the mechanisms of genomic changes in microbial cells and evolution.
  6. Discuss assessing microbial community composition and function.
learningOutcomes.en:
On completion of this course, the student will be able to:
  1. Associate the cellular structures of microorganisms with their roles in physiology.
  2. Explain microbial growth dynamics, discuss the associated cellular processes, and quantitatively assess population growth.
  3. Discuss the regulatory mechanisms of microorganisms and analyze them in terms of resource use and speed of adaptation.
  4. Examine diverse strategies of microorganisms to fulfil fundamental metabolic needs and analyze microbial metabolism using computational tools.
  5. Appraise the mechanisms of genomic changes in microbial cells and evolution.
  6. Discuss assessing microbial community composition and function.

content.fi: This course will provide a comprehensive exploration of microbial physiology, unraveling the role of cellular structures, mechanisms, and processes in sustaining life across diverse environmental conditions and influencing the performance of cells in biotechnological applications. Encoding of the cellular capabilities in the genome and how the genomes can change and evolve will be investigated. Quantitative aspects of microbial physiology will be delved into and evaluated in single-species populations and microbial communities through computational tools.

prerequisites.fi: Conservation laws, ordinary differential equations, linear algebra and elements of programming and numerical methods.
prerequisites.sv: Conservation laws, ordinary differential equations, linear algebra and elements of programming and numerical methods.
prerequisites.en: Conservation laws, ordinary differential equations, linear algebra and elements of programming and numerical methods.

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the course, the participant will understand:
  • Unconstrained and constrained numerical optimsation (Newton's type methods, automatic differentiation);
  • Discrete-time optimal control (Dynamic programming: Basic, iterative and differential variants);
  • Continuous-time optimal control (Hamilton-Jacobi-Bellman, Pontryagin approaches, direct approaches);
  • On-line optimal control (Model predictive control, moving-horizion estimation and control).
learningOutcomes.sv:
After the course, the participant will understand:
  • Unconstrained and constrained numerical optimsation (Newton's type methods, automatic differentiation);
  • Discrete-time optimal control (Dynamic programming: Basic, iterative and differential variants);
  • Continuous-time optimal control (Hamilton-Jacobi-Bellman, Pontryagin approaches, direct approaches);
  • On-line optimal control (Model predictive control, moving-horizion estimation and control).
learningOutcomes.en:
After the course, the participant will understand:
  • Unconstrained and constrained numerical optimsation (Newton's type methods, automatic differentiation);
  • Discrete-time optimal control (Dynamic programming: Basic, iterative and differential variants);
  • Continuous-time optimal control (Hamilton-Jacobi-Bellman, Pontryagin approaches, direct approaches);
  • On-line optimal control (Model predictive control, moving-horizion estimation and control).

literature.en:
• Nocedal, J. and Wright, S. J., Nonlinear optimization, 2006;
  • Bertsekas, D. P., Dynamic programing and optimal control, vol. I & II, 2017 & 2012;
  • Bertsekas, D. P., Reinforcement learning and optimal control, 2019;
  • Betts, J. T., Practical methods for optimal control and estimation using nonlinear programming, 2009;

content.fi: We study the mathematical principles of optimal control to manipulate the dynamic behaviour of process systems and the numerics used for its solution. The course aims at bringing understanding on how to combine numerical optimisation with dynamical systems theory to formulate and solve optimal control problems in both discrete- and continuous-time. We develop the topic in general application domains in chemical and bio-chemical engineering.

learningOutcomes.fi: After passing the course student can: apply the mixed potential theory to kinetic and equilibrium evaluations of leaching and corrosion systems, design and conduct electrochemical experiments to measure reaction rates and corrosion rates and corrosion probabilities, dimension a leaching, solution purification and recovery process based on selected aims, such as yield, selectivity or residence time, apply the techniques of materials selection and corrosion engineering to the design of processing equipment.

learningOutcomes.fi:
The course provides basic skills to specialize in material science including especially polymer technology.
After the course, the student has the ability to:
- identify the diversity and usability of polymers in different applications
- describe polymerization mechanisms and technical manufacturing methods
- understand how the size and form diversity of the molecules affect the properties of a material (eg. thermal and mechanical properties)
- describe how a plastic product is manufactured from a polymer

content.fi: The learning outcomes of the course are principles of polymer science and technology as well as polymer structure property correlations. The course covers basics of polymer chemistry, polymer physics and polymer materials analysis and testing. The most important polymer types are introduced and their properties, uses, and manufacturing will be discussed. The students will get familiar with engineering polymers, specialty polymers and bio-polymers. The course covers basics of polymerization and polymer processing technologies.

learningOutcomes.fi:
After completing the courese, the students should be able to: 
- explain how enzyme catalysis works (on a very fundamental level: drawing "reaction coordinate vs. free energy" diagrams) 
- name different methods for protein engineering and evaluate their potential 
- draw chemical reaction mechanisms relevant for biochemistry ("pushing electrons") 
- describe the composition and reactivity of important biomolecules 
- visualize the 3D structure of proteins via the softwar PyMol 
- present scientific concepts to peers 
- search and evaluate state-of-the-art science
learningOutcomes.sv:
After completing the courese, the students should be able to: 
- explain how enzyme catalysis works (on a very fundamental level: drawing "reaction coordinate vs. free energy" diagrams) 
- name different methods for protein engineering and evaluate their potential 
- draw chemical reaction mechanisms relevant for biochemistry ("pushing electrons") 
- describe the composition and reactivity of important biomolecules 
- visualize the 3D structure of proteins via the softwar PyMol 
- present scientific concepts to peers 
- search and evaluate state-of-the-art science

- explain how enzyme catalysis works (on a very fundamental level: drawing "reaction coordinate vs. free energy" diagrams) 
- name different methods for protein engineering and evaluate their potential 
- draw chemical reaction mechanisms relevant for biochemistry ("pushing electrons")

content.fi: Repetition of fundamental chemistry related to biochemistry. Revision of amino acids and non-covalent forces responsible for the 3D structure of proteins (going more into detail than CHEM-A1310 or CHEM-C1300). Bioenergetics (thermodynamics relevant for biochemistry). Theoretic analysis of enzyme catalysis. Draw reaction coordinates and interpret them. Principles of how to develop an enzyme inhibitor. Enzyme kinetics with one substrate. Comparison of enzyme catalysis vs. classical catalysis. Cofactors. Enzyme engineering and selected strategies to do this, including directed evolution. Biocatalysis and applications.

Enzyme kinetics with one substrate. Comparison of enzyme catalysis vs. classical catalysis. Cofactors. Enzyme engineering and selected strategies to do this, including directed evolution. Biocatalysis and applications.

Biocatalysis and applications.

prerequisites.fi: Pakolliset esitiedot: CHEM-A1310 Biotieteen perusteet TAI CHEM-C1300 Fundamental BiosciencesSuositeltavat esitiedot: CHEM-A1100 Teollisuuden toimintaympäristö ja prosessit
prerequisites.sv: Obligatoriska förkunskaper: CHEM-A1310 Grunderna i biovetenskap ELLER CHEM-C1300 Fundamental BiosciencesRekommenderade förkunskaper: CHEM-A1100 Industrins omgivning och dess processer
prerequisites.en: Compulsory prerequisites: CHEM-A1310 Basics in Bioscience OR CHEM-C1300 Fundamental BiosciencesRecommended prerequisites: CHEM-A1100 Industrial Environment and Its Processes

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin suoritettuaan opiskelija osaa
  1. kuvailla biotekniikkaa teollisuuden alana ja sen tuotteita ja menetelmiä sekä sovelluksia eri alueilla ja käsitellä teollisen biotekniikan mahdollisuuksia ja haasteita
  2. esittää bioprosesseissa esiintyviä siirtoilmiöitä (aine- ja energia-) kvalitatiivisesti ja kvantitatiivisesti sekä esittää arvioita biologisten komponenttien (solut, proteiinit, substraatit, tuotteet, entsyymit) käyttäytymisestä prosessiolosuhteissa
  3. tunnistaa aseptiikan vaatimukset laite- ja prosessiratkaisuissa sekä käytännön toteutuksessa  
  4. konseptitasolla yhdistää bioprosessitekniikan yksikköoperaatioita prosessiratkaisuiksi ja tunnistaa näissä esiintyviä ilmiöitä ja vaikuttavia tekijöitä
  5. muodostaa yksinkertaisia aine- ja energiataseisiin sekä differentiaaliyhtälöihin perustuvia prosessimalleja solu- ja entsyymiprosesseille
  6. nimetä bioprosessien avainmuuttujat ja kuvailla niihin liittyviä mittaustekniikoita ja laskennallisia ratkaisuja  sekä prosessien säädön periaatteita.
learningOutcomes.sv:
Efter kursen har den studerande kompentens att:
  1. Beskriva bioteknik som industriell sektor och dess produkter och metoder samt applikationer inom olika områden, och avhandla den industriella bioteknikens potential och utmaningar
  2. Presentera övergångsfenomen (materie och energi) inom bioprocesser kvalitativt och kvantitativt samt presentera kalkyler av biologiska komponenters beteende (celler, proteiner, substrat, enzymer) under processförhållanden
  3. Nämna aseptiska krav vid apparat- och processlösningar och praktiska applikationer
  4. På konceptnivå kunna anknyta bioprocessteknikens enhetsoperationer till processlösningar och identifiera fenomen och faktorer som påverkar dessa
  5. Formulera enkla processimulationer för cell- och enzymatiska processer som baserar sig på balansräkning av materie och energi.samt differentialekvationer.
  6. Nämna de viktigaste variablerna vid bioprocesser och avbilda mätningstekniker och matematiska lösningar och grunder för processkontroll.
learningOutcomes.en:
After completing the course the student will be able to:
  1. Describe biotechnology as an industrial sector and products and methods thereof, including applications in different fields and challenges and opportunities of industrial biotechnology
  2. Present transition phenomena in bioprocesses (matter and energy-) qualitatively and quantitatively and estimations of the behavior of biological components (cells, proteins, substrates, products, enzymes) under process conditions
  3. Identity the aseptic requirements in equipment- and process design and applications thereof
  4. Present the concept of joining unit operations into bioprocesses and identify phenomena thereof and factors influencing such phenomena
  5. Formulate basic process models for cell and enzymatic processes based on matter- and energy balance and differential equations
  6. Name key variables of bioprocesses and describe the measuring technologies thereof as well as mathematic solutions and basics of process controls

content.fi:
Solut: toiminta reaktoreissa, kasvun ja tuoton kinetiikka ja kvantitointi, dynaamiset ilmiöt, prosessien toteutustavat ja niihin liittyvät yksinkertaiset matemaattiset käsittelyt, aineenvaihdunnan perusteet systeemisessä tarkastelussa.
Entsyymit:  toiminta reaktoreissa (homogeeninen katalyysi), reaktioiden termodynamiikka, tasapainoreaktiot, käytännön kinetiikka, immobilisoidut entsyymit ja aineensiirron vaikutukset periaatetasolla, koentsyymien tarve ja regeneraatio, inktivoituminen ja sen kinetiikka.
(Bio)reaktorit: tyypilliset ratkaisut, siirtoilmiöt, aseptiikka reaktorien suunnittelussa, mittaus- ja säätötekniset ratkaisut.
Prosessit: tyypillisten yksikköoperaatioiden perusteet, aine- ja energiataseiden hyödyntäminen, biologisten tekijöiden huomioonottaminen prosessisuunnittelussa.
Ilmiöiden, operaatioiden ja prosessien matemaattisen mallintamisen perusteet erityisesti biokomponentit huomioiden.
content.sv:
En grundkurs inom Bioprocessteknologi som handlar om:
Celler: reaktorernas funktion, kinetik och kvantifiering av tillväxt och produktion, dynamiska fenomen, förverkligande av processer och därtill hörande enkla matematiska handlingar, systematisk granskning av grunderna i metabolin
Enzymer: funktion inom reaktorer (homogen katalys), termodynamik, reaktionsbalans, kinetik, immobiliserande enzymer och grunder på övergång av materie, behov för koenzymer, regeneration, inaktivering och dess kinetiken
(Bio)reaktorer: typiska lösningar, övergångsfenomen, aseptik inom planering av reaktorer, mätnings- och regleringstekniska lösningar
Processer: typiska grunder vid enhetsoperationer, utnyttjande av materie- och energibalans, beaktande av biologiska faktorer inom processplanering
Grunderna i simulation av fenomen, operationer och processer i synnerhet med beaktande av biologiska komponenter
content.en:
A basic course in Bioprocess technology with focus on:
Cells: function in reactors, kinetics of growth and yield, kinetics and qantification, dynamic phenomena, practical applications of processes and basic mathematics thereof, basic of metabolism from a systemic point of view
Enzymes: function in reactors (homogeneous catalysis), thermodynamics of reactions, mass balance, kinetics, immobilized enzymes and mass transfer of reactions, coenzymes and regeneration, inactivation and kinetics thereof.
(Bio)reactors: typical solutions, transfer phenomena, aseptics in reaction design, methods for measurements and control
Processes: basics of typical process operations, use of matter and energy balances, bipological factors to be considered with reference to process design
Basics of phenomena and mathematic modeling of operations and processes with specific focus on biological components.

assesmentMethods.fi: Kurssin runko koostuu luennnoista ja laskuharjoituksista. Opiskelijat suorittavat itsenäisesti annettuja harjoitustehtäviä.  Arvostelu perustuu opiskelijan kurssin aikana suorittamiin harjoitus- tai muihin tehtäviin. Kurssisuoritus edellyttää kurssipalautteen antamista palautejärjestelmän kautta.
assesmentMethods.sv: Föreläsningar och utförande av räkneuppgifter och utförande av givna uppgifter individuellt. Bedömningen är baserad på individuellt utförda uppgifter som har gjorts under kursen och tentamen.
assesmentMethods.en: The course includes lectures and exercises.  Students have calculation-assignments and carry out given assignments independently. Grading is based on independent assignments completed during the course and course examination.

substitutes.fi: KE-70.2500 Bioprosessitekniikka I

prerequisites.fi: Recommended prerequisites: CHEM-E4130 Chemistry of the Elements and CHEM-4155 Solid State Chemistry or similar knowledge
prerequisites.sv: Recommended prerequisites: CHEM-E4130 Chemistry of the Elements and CHEM-4155 Solid State Chemistry or similar knowledge
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: CHEM-E4130 Chemistry of the Elements and CHEM-4155 Solid State Chemistry or similar knowledge

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the course the student will be able to
  1. use symmetry elements for the description of the symmetries of molecules and crystals
  2. determine the point group for a molecule
  3. read the space group symbols so as to understand the information provided by the symbol
  4. draw unit cells once the space group, lattice parameters, and atomic coordinates are known
  5. explain the diffraction phenomenon
  6. explain the steps in crystal structure determination and the principles of Rietveld refinement; evaluate the feasibility of a crystal structure model based on a bond valence sum (BVS) calculation
  7. understand the interplay between crystal structure, local chemical environment and redox chemistry
  8. explain the principles of the most important structural characterization techniques and understand and critically evaluate the information revealed by the techniques for inorganic materials
  9. select the most suitable techniques for each specific structure-related research problem, for both bulk and thin-film samples

  5. explain the diffraction phenomenon
  6. explain the steps in crystal structure determination and the principles of Rietveld refinement; evaluate the feasibility of a crystal structure model based on a bond valence sum (BVS) calculation
  7. understand the interplay between crystal structure, local chemical environment and redox chemistry
  8. explain the principles of the most important structural characterization techniques and understand and critically evaluate the information revealed by the techniques for inorganic materials
  9. select the most suitable techniques for each specific structure-related research problem, for both bulk and thin-film samples

  5. explain the diffraction phenomenon
  6. explain the steps in crystal structure determination and the principles of Rietveld refinement; evaluate the feasibility of a crystal structure model based on a bond valence sum (BVS) calculation
  7. understand the interplay between crystal structure, local chemical environment and redox chemistry
  8. explain the principles of the most important structural characterization techniques and understand and critically evaluate the information revealed by the techniques for inorganic materials
  9. select the most suitable techniques for each specific structure-related research problem, for both bulk and thin-film samples

content.fi: The course deals with structural characterization techniques of inorganic materials (both bulk and thin-film samples), and covers also the basics of crystallography. The emphases are on the various diffraction and spectroscopic methods used for phase identification, crystal structure determination and studies of chemical environment (coordination sphere and oxidation state).

The emphases are on the various diffraction and spectroscopic methods used for phase identification, crystal structure determination and studies of chemical environment (coordination sphere and oxidation state).

  6. explain the steps in crystal structure determination and the principles of Rietveld refinement; evaluate the feasibility of a crystal structure model based on a bond valence sum (BVS) calculation
  7. understand the interplay between crystal structure, local chemical environment and redox chemistry
  8. explain the principles of the most important structural characterization techniques and understand and critically evaluate the information revealed by the techniques for inorganic materials
  9. select the most suitable techniques for each specific structure-related research problem, for both bulk and thin-film samples
learningOutcomes.en:
After the course the student will be able to
  1. use symmetry elements for the description of the symmetries of molecules and crystals
  2. determine the point group for a molecule
  3. read the space group symbols so as to understand the information provided by the symbol
  4. draw unit cells once the space group, lattice parameters, and atomic coordinates are known
  5. explain the diffraction phenomenon
  6. explain the steps in crystal structure determination and the principles of Rietveld refinement; evaluate the feasibility of a crystal structure model based on a bond valence sum (BVS) calculation
  7. understand the interplay between crystal structure, local chemical environment and redox chemistry
  8. explain the principles of the most important structural characterization techniques and understand and critically evaluate the information revealed by the techniques for inorganic materials
  9. select the most suitable techniques for each specific structure-related research problem, for both bulk and thin-film samples

content.fi: The course deals with structural characterization techniques of inorganic materials (both bulk and thin-film samples), and covers also the basics of crystallography. The emphases are on the various diffraction and spectroscopic methods used for phase identification, crystal structure determination and studies of chemical environment (coordination sphere and oxidation state).

prerequisites.fi: Pakolliset esitiedot: Laboratorioturvallisuuskurssi CHEM-A1030, CHEM-E0111, CHEM-A1010 tai CHEM-E0140 on oltava suoritettuna ennen laboratoriotöiden aloittamista.
prerequisites.sv: Obligatoriska förkunskaper: För deltagande i laborationerna krävs godkänd kurs i laborationssäkerhet: CHEM-A1030, CHEM-E0111, CHEM-A1010 eller CHEM-E0140.
prerequisites.en: Compulsory prerequisites: The laboratory safety course CHEM-A1030, CHEM-E0111, CHEM-A1010 or CHEM-E0140 must be completed before starting laboratory work.

learningOutcomes.fi: Kurssin suoritettuaan opiskelija osaa kuvata materiaaliryhmät (metallit, keraamit, polymeerit, biomateriaalit ja komposiitit) ja kertoa niiden tärkeimmät ominaisuudet ja käyttökohteet. Opiskelija tunnistaa materiaalitieteen peruskäsitteet rakenteesta, ominaisuuksista, valmistusmenetelmistä ja karakterisointimittauksista. Hän ymmärtää sidoksen, nanoskaalan, mikrorakenteen ja makroskooppisten materiaaliominaisuuksien väliset yhteydet. Hän osaa laskea suuruusluokka-arvioita materiaaliominaisuuksista. Hän ymmärtää materiaalivarojen ja prosessoinnin merkityksen kestävälle kehitykselle. Lisäksi opiskelija osaa suunnitella ja toteuttaa yksinkertaisen materiaaliominaisuuksien mittauksen, ja raportoida siitä tieteellisessä muodossa.
learningOutcomes.sv: Efter kursen känner studenten till materialgrupperna, metaller, keramer, polymerer, biomaterial, halvledare, kompositer och vet på basen av deras huvudegenskaper hur deras användningsområden bestäms och känner till materialvetenskapens grundbegrepp, såsom sammansättning, struktur, framställningssätt och hur dessa påverkar materialegenskaper. Studenten lär sig att med hjälp av instruktioner mäta olika egenskaper och skriva rapport. Studerande förstår vikten av materiella resurser och bearbetning för hållbar utveckling.
learningOutcomes.en: After the course the student knows the material groups, metals, ceramics, polymers, biomaterials, semiconductors, composites and knows the main properties which determine their use in application, and knows the principles of materials science such as composition, microstructure, processing and how these effect materials properties. The student knows how to measure material properties and write a report. S/he understands the importance of materials resources and processing for sustainable development.

content.fi: Materiaaliryhmät. Metallit, keraamit, polymeerit, luonnnonmateriaalit, komposiitit. Pinnat ja pinnoitteet. Materiaalien rakenne sidos- kide- ja mikrotasolla, ja niiden vaikutus makroskooppisiin ominaisuuksiin. Tärkeimmät mekaaniset, sähköiset ja termiset ominaisuudet. Valmistuksen, rakenteen, ominaisuuksien ja käyttösovellutusten väliset riippuvuudet. Materiaalivarat ja materiaalien kierrätys.
content.sv: Materialgrupper. Metaller, keramik, polymerer, naturmaterial, kompositer. Ytor och beläggningar. Struktur av material från atombindning, kristalstruktur or mikroskopisk struktur och deras effekt på makroskopiska egenskaper. De viktigaste mekaniska, elektriska och termiska egenskaperna. Beroendeförhållanden mellan tillverkning, struktur, egenskaper och applikationer. Materialresurser och återvinning av material.
content.en: Materials groups. Metals, ceramics, polymers, natural materials, composites. Surfaces and coatings. Structure of materials from atomic bonds, crystalline structure and microstructure to their their effects on macroscopic properties. The most important mechanical, electrical and thermal properties. Dependencies between manufacturing, structure, properties and applications. Material resources and recycling of materials.

prerequisites.fi: Compulsory prerequisites: CHEM-A1310 Biotieteen perusteet or CHEM-C1300 Fundamental Biosciences or similar knowledge. There, the biological foundations are covered, such as cell structure, infromation flow from DNA-RNA-protein etc.Recommended prerequisites: CHEM-C2330 Biochemistry is strongly recommended. There, the function and role of enzymes are covered.

learningOutcomes.fi:
After completing the course, the student is able to:
  • Explain the differences between anabolic and catabolic pathways
  • Understand the basic thermodynamics relevant for metabolism (bioenergetics)
  • Explain how ATP is produced from the oxidation of carbohydrates and fatty acids; and calculate how much ATP is produced
  • Name all intermediates of glycolysis and draw their structural formulas
  • Name all intermediates of the citric acid cycle and draw their structural formulas
  • Explain the differences between glycolysis and gluconeogenesis, and why these differences are needed
  • Explain the differences between the oxidative and the reductive citric acid cycle, and why these differences are needed
  • Explain the differences between fatty acid degradation and synthesis, and why these differences are needed
  • Explain how the electron transport chain works
  • Name different CO2-fixation pathway and describe their differences
  • Explain the function of different electron carriers in terms of their use and redox potential
  • Identify redox reactions and calculate oxidation numbers
  • Understand the importance of metabolism for biology and biotechnology
  • Learn independently and manage time
  • Integrate and evaluate information from a variety of sources

content.fi:
The focus is metabolism on a fundamental level relevant to all forms of life, with emphasis on the chemistry of intermediates. Careful look at the balance of atoms, electrons (redox state) and energy during metabolic pathways. 
One part is the aerobic energy metabolism (catabolism): glycolysis, citric acid cycle, electron transport and oxidative phosphorylation, degradation of lipids, amino acids, nucleotides. Selected anabolic pathways ("reverse direction") will be discussed: gluconeogenesis, fatty acid synthesis, amino acid synthesis.  
A second part is the anaerobic metabolism, with a focus on CO2 fixation. Calvin cycle, reverse citric acid cycle, introduction to all known CO2-fixation pathways. Bioenergetics. Energy conservation in methanogens and acetogens. Utilization of hydrogen as an electron source. Concept of electron bifurcation.
Applications of metabolic pathways for the production of value-added products from CO2 or from biomass-derived feedstocks. Introduction to metabolic engineering.

Selected anabolic pathways ("reverse direction") will be discussed: gluconeogenesis, fatty acid synthesis, amino acid synthesis.  
A second part is the anaerobic metabolism, with a focus on CO2 fixation. Calvin cycle, reverse citric acid cycle, introduction to all known CO2-fixation pathways. Bioenergetics. Energy conservation in methanogens and acetogens. Utilization of hydrogen as an electron source. Concept of electron bifurcation.
Applications of metabolic pathways for the production of value-added products from CO2 or from biomass-derived feedstocks. Introduction to metabolic engineering.
content.en:
The focus is metabolism on a fundamental level relevant to all forms of life, with emphasis on the chemistry of intermediates. Careful look at the balance of atoms, electrons (redox state) and energy during metabolic pathways. 
One part is the aerobic energy metabolism (catabolism): glycolysis, citric acid cycle, electron transport and oxidative phosphorylation, degradation of lipids, amino acids, nucleotides. Selected anabolic pathways ("reverse direction") will be discussed: gluconeogenesis, fatty acid synthesis, amino acid synthesis.  
A second part is the anaerobic metabolism, with a focus on CO2 fixation. Calvin cycle, reverse citric acid cycle, introduction to all known CO2-fixation pathways. Bioenergetics. Energy conservation in methanogens and acetogens. Utilization of hydrogen as an electron source. Concept of electron bifurcation.
Applications of metabolic pathways for the production of value-added products from CO2 or from biomass-derived feedstocks. Introduction to metabolic engineering.

learningOutcomes.fi: After the course the student will have a basic knowledge about transition metal complexes. Student will be familiar with the geometry and reactivity of complexes. Student will know the most important reactions and their mechanisms. Moreover the students will get basic knowledge about the industrial use of transition metal complexes.

content.fi: This course is an introduction to transition metal-mediated organic chemistry. Student will be familiar with the reaction mechanism related to Organometallic chemistry. Student will have understanding of different properties that certain organometallic complexes have: Electron count, basicity, electrophility/nucleophilicity, ligand strength/exchange and their industrial use). The main focus will be in homogeneous catalytic systems that are currently used in both academia and industry. Emphasis will also be given to the understanding of properties of organometallic complexes and their interaction with substrates.

workload.fi: 5 op = 135 h. Kurssi koostuu projektityöskentelystä ryhmässä ja yksilötyöskentelystä sekä loppuarvioinnista. Kurssi sisältää myös projektityöskentelyä tukevaa lähiopetusta. Kontaktiopetus 24 h
workload.sv: 5 sp = 135 h. Kursen baserar sig på projektarbete i grupp samt individuellt arbete och en slutbedömning. Kursen innehåller också kontaktundervisning för att stöda projektarbetet. Kontaktundervisning 24h
workload.en: 5 cr = 135 h. The course contains project work in groups, individual studying and evaluation. The course also includes contact teaching supporting the project work. Contact teaching 24h

prerequisites.fi: Pakolliset esitiedot: CHEM-A1410 Materiaalitieteen perusteet. Laboratorioturvallisuuskurssi CHEM-A1030, CHEM-E0111, CHEM-A1010 tai CHEM-E0140 on oltava suoritettuna ennen laboratoriotöiden aloittamista.Suositellut esitiedot: CHEM-A1290 Orgaanisen kemian peruskurssi
prerequisites.sv: Obligatoriska förkunskaper: CHEM-A1410 Grunder i materialvetenskap. För deltagande i laborationerna krävs godkänd kurs i laborationssäkerhet: CHEM-A1030, CHEM-E0111, CHEM-A1010 eller CHEM-E0140.Rekommenderade förkunskaper: CHEM-A1290 Grundkurs i organisk kemi
prerequisites.en: Compulsory prerequisites: CHEM-A1410 Introduction to Materials Science. The laboratory safety course CHEM-A1030, CHEM-E0111, CHEM-A1010 or CHEM-E0140 must be completed before starting laboratory work.Recommended prerequisites: CHEM-A1290 Fundamentals of Organic Chemistry

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssi antaa perusvalmiuksia asiantuntijuudesta materiaalitieteen, erityisesti polymeerien, alueelta. Kurssin tavoitteina on opettaa opiskelijoille polymeeritieteen ja teknologian perusteet sekä polymeerien rakenne/ominaisuus korrelaatioita.
 Kurssin suoritettuaan opiskelija:
- hahmottaa polymeerien monimuotoisuutta ja laajaa soveltuvuutta eri käyttökohteissa
- osaa kuvata polymeroitumismekanismit ja polymeerien tekniset valmistustavat
- ymmärtää molekyylien suuruuden, koostumuksen ja muodon vaikutuksia materiaalin ominaisuuksiin (mm. termiset ja mekaaniset ominaisuudet)
- osaa kuvata, miten muovituotteita valmistetaan polymeereistä.
learningOutcomes.sv:
Kursen ger grundläggande färdigheter i att fungera som specialist inom materialteknik speciellt gällande polymerer.
Efter att ha genomfört kursen kan studeranden:
- gestalta diversiteten och det breda användningsområdet av polymerer - beskriva polymerisationsmekanismer och teknisk tillverkning av polymerer- förstå hur molekylens storlek och mångfalden i dess form påverkar materialets egenskaper (t.ex. termiska och mekaniska egenskaper)- beskriva hur man tillverkar en plastprodukt från en polymer
learningOutcomes.en:
The course provides basic skills to specialize in material science including especially polymer technology.
After the course, the student has the ability to:
- identify the diversity and usability of polymers in different applications - describe polymerization mechanisms and technical manufacturing methods- understand how the size and form diversity of the molecules affect the properties of a material (eg. thermal and mechanical properties) - describe how a plastic product is manufactured from a polymer

content.fi: Kurssi kattaa polymeerikemian ja -fysiikan peruskäsitteet sekä polymeerien analyysi- ja testausmenetelmät. Kurssilla esitellään yleisimmät polymeerityypit sekä perehdytään niiden valmistamiseen, ominaisuuksiin ja käyttökohteisiin. Samalla tutustutaan erilaisten polymerointimekanismien perusteihin sekä polymeerien teollisiin prosesseihin. Kurssilla opiskelijat tutustuvat myös teknisiin, erikois- ja biopolymeereihin.
content.sv: På kursen lär man sig grundbegreppen i polymerteknologi, grunderna gällande polymerers egenskaper samt mätandet av dessa. Dessutom lär studeranden sig principerna i tillverkningsmetoder för plastprodukter. Man bekantar sig med både naturliga och syntetiska polymerer inklusive de viktigaste tekniska polymertyperna samt tillverkning och bearbetning av dessa. Kursen behandlar också gummiteknologi samt specialpolymerer som t.ex. biopolymerer.
content.en: On the course you will learn the basic concepts of polymer technology, as well as essentials regarding polymer properties and measuring those. Additionally you will learn about manufacturing methods for plastic products. You will get familiar with the most important natural and synthetic polymers, along with main technical polymer grades including manufacturing and machining of those.  The course also offers an overview of rubbers and special polymers including eg. biopolymers.

assesmentMethods.fi: Kurssilla on luentoja ja harjoituksia ryhmissä tehtävän projektityön tukena. Kurssilla työskennellään myös itsenäisesti ja osallistutaan loppuarviointiin.
assesmentMethods.sv: Kursen innehåller föreläsningar och övningar som stöder projektarbetet som görs i grupp. Kursen innehåller även självständigt arbete samt deltagande i slutbedömningen.
assesmentMethods.en: The course consists of lectures and exercises to support the group projects. The course requires individual studying and participation in the final evaluation.

substitutes.sv: CHEM-C3420 Basics of Polymer Technology (samma kurs på engelska)
substitutes.en: CHEM-C3420 Basics of Polymer Technology (same course in English)

additionalInformation.fi: Opetuskieli: suomi Opetusperiodi: 2024-2025 Kevät III - IV  2025-2026 Kevät III - IV Ilmoittautuminen: Max 200 opiskelijaa mutta kaikki kemiantekniikan kandidaattiohjelmaan kuuluvat opiskelijat hyväksytään jos ilmoittautuneet ajoissa Kurssin toteutus voidaan perua, jos kyseiselle toteutukselle ilmoittautuneita opiskelijoita on alle viisi. Jos toteutus perutaan, tulee opiskelijoille tarjota vaihtoehtoinen tapa suorittaa kurssi, tai ehdotus muusta soveltuvasta suoritettavasta kurssista.

prerequisites.fi: Recommended prerequisites: CHEM-C2430 (Polymeeriteknologian perusteet) and CHEM-C2220 (Orgaanisen synteesin perusteet) are recommended.
prerequisites.sv: Recommended prerequisites: CHEM-C2430 (Polymeeriteknologian perusteet) and CHEM-C2220 (Orgaanisen synteesin perusteet) are recommended.
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: CHEM-C2430 (Polymeeriteknologian perusteet) and CHEM-C2220 (Orgaanisen synteesin perusteet) are recommended.

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the course the student
  • Can identify and separate the most important ideal mechanisms of polymerisations.
  • Is able to explain basics of initiation and catalysis.
  • Is able to explain the formation of polymer structures, their characterisation and ways to affect them.
  • Can apply theories of step and chain polymerizations.

After the course the student
  • Can identify and separate the most important ideal mechanisms of polymerisations.
  • Is able to explain basics of initiation and catalysis.
  • Is able to explain the formation of polymer structures, their characterisation and ways to affect them.
  • Can apply theories of step and chain polymerizations.

content.fi: The course deepens the knowledge in the field of polymer synthesis, purification and analysis. Polymerisation mechanisms, kinetics and bioconjugates are discussed.

learningOutcomes.fi:
The aim of the course is to give understanding on making process: Process development, Preliminary and Basic design. This course will help you to perform Practical Design Project form industry in Master education as well as skills in process and plant design, hand calculations, Aspen simulation and ability to work in the chemical process industry.  After the course student:
  1. Understands the basics of process development, preliminary and basic design of chemical processes
  2. Can search information for market and carry out feasibility study
  3. Can draw process flow diagrams (PFD), piping and instrumentation (PI) and layout drawings 
  4. Can calculate material and energy balances and use of process simulation tools
  5. Can size the equipment, such as reactors, tanks, pumps, heat exchangers, pipes, control valves and solid handling
  6. Can select the appropriate construction materials
  7. Can understand energy savings and calculate heat integration by using pinch technology
  8. Can calculate process economics
  9. Can apply  environmental, health and safety (EHS) principles in design

content.fi:
1. Process design steps, design approach, process selection, evaluation of the process concept and comparison, information searching.
  2. Selection of process chemistry, conceptual design and feasibility study, process design. Selection and dimensioning the equipment (reactors, tanks, columns, mechanical separation devices), heat exchangers, pumps, compressors and pipes.
  3. Drawing of flowsheets, process flow diagrams (PFD) and piping & instrumentation (PI) diagrams, layout drawings, basic controls of process, and selection of construction materials
  4. Process economics, investment and profitability
  5. Process heat integration, Pinch analysis
  6. Health, safety and environment (HSE), wastes
  7. Process simulation (recycle, VLE, LLE, flash)
  8. Process simulation (reactors)
  9. Process simulation (distillation, absorption, etc.)
  10. Process simulation (optimization of a process)

prerequisites.fi: Recommended prerequisites: Conservation laws, ordinary differential equations, linear algebra and elements of optimisation and probability theory.
prerequisites.sv: Recommended prerequisites: Conservation laws, ordinary differential equations, linear algebra and elements of optimisation and probability theory.
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: Conservation laws, ordinary differential equations, linear algebra and elements of optimisation and probability theory.

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the course, the participant will understand:
  • Dynamic process models using input-output and state-space representations;
  • Process dynamics and stability of linear time-invariant process models;
  • Controllability and observability of linear time-invariant process models;
  • State-feedback control and the synthesis of linear quadratic regulators LQR;
  • Optimal state estimation and the Kalman filter;
  • Optimal estimation and control using linear quadratic Gaussian regulators LQG.
learningOutcomes.sv:
After the course, the participant will understand:
  • Dynamic process models using input-output and state-space representations;
  • Process dynamics and stability of linear time-invariant process models;
  • Controllability and observability of linear time-invariant process models;
  • State-feedback control and the synthesis of linear quadratic regulators LQR;
  • Optimal state estimation and the Kalman filter;
  • Optimal estimation and control using linear quadratic Gaussian regulators LQG.
learningOutcomes.en:
After the course, the participant will understand:
  • Dynamic process models using input-output and state-space representations;
  • Process dynamics and stability of linear time-invariant process models;
  • Controllability and observability of linear time-invariant process models;
  • State-feedback control and the synthesis of linear quadratic regulators LQR;
  • Optimal state estimation and the Kalman filter;
  • Optimal estimation and control using linear quadratic Gaussian regulators LQG.

content.fi: We study the mathematical principles and the basic computational tools of state-feedback and optimal control to manipulate the dynamic behaviour of process systems. The course aims at understanding state-feedback control in process systems, while at the same time showing how this approach can be used in general application domains in chemical and bio-chemical engineering.
content.sv: We study the mathematical principles and the basic computational tools of state-feedback and optimal control to manipulate the dynamic behaviour of process systems. The course aims at understanding state-feedback control in process systems, while at the same time showing how this approach can be used in general application domains in chemical and bio-chemical engineering.
content.en: We study the mathematical principles and the basic computational tools of state-feedback and optimal control to manipulate the dynamic behaviour of process systems. The course aims at understanding state-feedback control in process systems, while at the same time showing how this approach can be used in general application domains in chemical and bio-chemical engineering.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin jälkeen opiskelija: - osaa valita soveltuvat menetelmät koesuunnitelman tekemiseen, aineiston analysointiin sekä visualisointi
- osaa soveltaa koesuunnittelussa ja koetulosten analysoinnissa erilaisia tilastollisia menetelmiä
- osaa käyttää soveltuvia ohjelmistoja yksinkertaisten koesuunnitelmien tekoon, koetulosten analysointiin sekä visualisointiin.
learningOutcomes.sv:
Studenten ska efter genomgången kurs kunna:
- välja lämpliga metoder för experimentell planering, dataanalys och visualisering- använda dessa metoder praktiskt vid experimentell planering och dataanalys- använda datorprogram för att planera, analysera och visualisera experimentell data
learningOutcomes.en:
After the course a student is able to:
- choose appropriate methods to plan an experiment, and to analyze and visualize the data- apply different statistical methods to formulate an experimental plan and to analyze the results- utilize computer programs create simple experimental plans, analyze data and to visualize the results

content.fi: - Koesuunnittelun periaatteet ja käytännön harjoittelu- Tutustuminen ja perehtyminen erilaisiin vaihtoehtoisiin ohjelmistoihin ja menetelmiin- Parhaiten soveltuvien koesuunnittelumenetelmien ja analysointimenetelmien valintaperusteet- Koetulosten analysoinnin harjoittelu- Datan ja aineistojen visualisointi ja havainnollistaminen
content.sv: Innehåll- grunder i planering av experiment och praktiska övningar- principerna bakom metodval och hur man väljer den "bästa" av ett antal föreslagna metoder och program- tillgängliga datorprogram för att utföra experimentell planering, dataanalys och visualisering- övningar för experimentell planering, dataanalys och visualisering
content.en: Contents- How to plan an experiment, exercises- Available experimental design and data analysis software and applications- Selection criteria for methods and programs used in experimental design and data analysis- Exercises in data analysis and visualization

prerequisites.fi: Compulsory prerequisites: CHEM-E6140 Fundamentals of Minerals Engineering and Recycling or equivalent course
prerequisites.sv: Compulsory prerequisites: CHEM-E6140 Fundamentals of Minerals Engineering and Recycling or equivalent course
prerequisites.en: Compulsory prerequisites: CHEM-E6140 Fundamentals of Minerals Engineering and Recycling or equivalent course

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the course the student can
-Dimension and select of equipment for mineral processing, taking into consideration the technological and economic constraints of each design
- Apply the principles of unit operations design for mineral processing equipment in the context of metals recycling
- Explain the interaction between the various unit operations in a mineral pro-cessing plant and the specific purpose of each processing unit
- Calculate properties of mineral products after processing operations, while considering the technical and economic issues of grade-recovery curves
learningOutcomes.sv:
After the course the student can
-Dimension and select of equipment for mineral processing, taking into consideration the technological and economic constraints of each design
- Apply the principles of unit operations design for mineral processing equipment in the context of metals recycling
- Explain the interaction between the various unit operations in a mineral pro-cessing plant and the specific purpose of each processing unit
- Calculate properties of mineral products after processing operations, while considering the technical and economic issues of grade-recovery curves
learningOutcomes.en:
After the course the student can
-Dimension and select of equipment for mineral processing, taking into consideration the technological and economic constraints of each design
- Apply the principles of unit operations design for mineral processing equipment in the context of metals recycling
- Explain the interaction between the various unit operations in a mineral pro-cessing plant and the specific purpose of each processing unit
- Calculate properties of mineral products after processing operations, while considering the technical and economic issues of grade-recovery curves

content.fi:
- Dimensioning of unit operations equipment used in mechanical processing technologies, including comminution, sizing/classification and concentration.
- Flowsheet development for the processing of primary and secondary resources.
- Process simulation of physical separation in mineral processing and recycling.

organizationName.en: Department of Chemical and Metallurgical Engineering

workload.fi: Luennot, laskuharjoitukset, itsenäinen opiskelu ja välikokeet/tentti.
workload.sv: Föreläsningar, räkneövningar, självständiga studier och mellanförhören/tentamen.
workload.en: Lectures, exercise sessions, independent study and midterm exams/exam.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin jälkeen opiskelija:
1. osaa selittää atomin rakenteen, jaksollisen järjestelmän perusperiaatteet ja kemialliset sidostyypit
2. osaa selittää sitoutumisen merkityksen kemiallisiin ja fysikaalisiin ominaisuuksiin
3. osaa kirjoittaa kemiallisia reaktioyhtälöitä ja soveltaa niitä käytännössä 
4. hallitsee kemiallisen tasapainon perusteet
5. tunnistaa termodynamiikan ja sähkökemian merkityksen
6. hallitsee kemian perusteet, joita tarvitaan kemiaan liittyvissä jatko-opinnoissa
learningOutcomes.sv:
Efter godkänd kurs ska studenten kunna:
1. förklara atomstrukturen, det periodiska systemets grundprinciper och olika typer av kemiska bindningar
2. förklara bindningens betydelse för ämnets kemiska och fysikaliska egenskaperna
3. skriva kemiska reaktionsformler och tillämpa dem i praktiken 
4. behärska den kemiska jämviktens grunder
5. identifiera betydelsen av termodynamik och elektrokemi
6. ha grunder för vidare kemistudier
learningOutcomes.en:
After completing the course, student is able to:
1. explain the atomic structure, basics of the periodic table and chemical bonding
2. explain the meaning of chemical bonding in the physical and chemical properties of material
3. produce chemical equations and apply them in practise
4. command the concept of chemical equilibrium
5. identifies the importance of thermodynamics and electrochemistry 
6. continue on more advanced courses in chemistry-related studies

content.fi:
• Atomin rakenne, jaksollinen järjestelmä, kemiallinen sitoutuminen
  • Stoikiometria, kemialliset reaktiot neste- ja kaasufaasissa
  • Termodynamiikka
  • Sähkökemialliset reaktiot
  • Erilaiset tasapainoreaktiot
  • kemiallisia sovelluksia
content.sv:
• atomstruktur, periodiska systemet, kemisk bindning
  • stökiometri och kemiska reaktioner i vätska och gasfas
  • termodynamik
  • elektrokemiska reaktioner
  • olika jämviktsreaktioner
  • kemiska tillämpningar
content.en:
• structure of atom, the periodic system, chemical bonding
  • stoichiometry, chemical reactions in liquid and gas phase
  • thermodynamics
  • electrochemical reactions
  • various types of chemical equilibrium
  • chemistry-based applications

Viikottaiset luennot ja niihin liittyvät MyCourses kotitehtävät. Tehtävissä on sekä monivalintaa luennosta että pieniä laskuja ja muita tehtäviä.
Kaksi projektityötä. Projektitöitä on yksi per periodi ja niissä sovelletaan opittua teoriaa selittämään kokeellista dataa. Projektitöihin on tarjolla tutorointia kolmen viikon aikana kerran viikossa.

prerequisites.fi: Suositellut esitiedot: Materiaalitieteen perusteet CHEM A1410
prerequisites.sv: Rekommenderade förkunskaper: Materialvetenskapens grunder CHEM A1410
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: Basics in Materials Science CHEM-A1410

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin jälkeen opiskelija:
Omaa perustason ymmärryksen kiteisen epäorgaanisen aineen: metallien, keraamien, piin, hiilimateriaalien, rakenteesta, muokkaamisesta, ominaisuuksista (erityisesti mekaaniset) ja sovelluksista.
Osaa kuutiollisen kiderakenteen kidetasojen ja kidesuuntien formalismia: Miller indeksit ja tasojen/suuntien väliset kulmat.
Hahmottaa kiderakenteen ja mikrorakenteen kautta yhtäläisyydet ja erot eri materiaaliryhmien välillä ja tämän avulla selittää materiaaliryhmien väliset erot ominaisuuksissa.  
Ymmärtää kahden komponentin faasidiagrammit ja osaa niiden avulla suunnitella lämpökäsittelyjä mekaanisten ominaisuuksien muokkaamiseksi.
Osaa kuvata tärkeimmät kidevirheet ja niiden vaikutukset ominaisuuksiin.
Osaa soveltaa ja yhdistellä opittua teoriaa kiderakenteesta, mikrorakenteesta ja mekaanisista ominaisuuksista selittämään kokeellisia tuloksia.
Syventää osaamistaan tieteellisestä kirjoittamisesta.
learningOutcomes.sv: Studeranden känner till mikrostruktur av metalliska material, keramiska material, kisel och kol material. Studeranden förstår hur man bearbetar mikrostrukturer och hur det påverkar de mekaniska egenskaperna. Studenten kan tillämpa den inlärda teorikunskapen till att analysera experimentella resultat och rapportera om resultaten i vetenskapligt skrivande.
learningOutcomes.en: Student is familiar with the microstructure of metallic materials, ceramic materials, silicon and carbon materials. Student understands how microstructure can be modified and how the modifications affect the mechanical properties. Student can apply the learned theory knowledge on analyzing experimental results and report on them through scientific writing.

content.fi: Kiteisen materiaalin rakenne: metallit, keraamit, pii ja hiilimateriaalit. Kiderakenteet ja kidevirheet. Kidesuuntien ja tasojen vektorilaskentaa, Miller indeksit. Liukoisuus ja diffuusio kiinteissä materiaaleissa. Faasidiagrammit ja faasitransitiot. Metallien mikrorakenteen muokkaus ja vaikutus metallin mekaanisiin ominaisuuksiin (lujitusmenetelmät ja lämpökäsittelyt). Piin rakenne, mekaaniset ja kemialliset ominaisuudet ja sovelluksia. Hiilimateriaalien rakenne, ominaisuudet ja sovelluksia.
content.sv:
- Kristallstruktur, kristallfel och diffusion
- Fasdiagram och fasförändringar
- Mekaniska egenskaper och deformationsmekanismer -Metaller, keramiker, kol och kisel struktur och egenskaper
content.en:
-Crystal structure, crystal defects and diffusion
- Phase diagrams and phase transitions
- Mechanical properties and deformation mechanisms -Metals, ceramics, silicon and carbon materials structure and properties

workload.fi: Luennot, viikkoharjoitukset, online-tentti (ryhmätentti tai yksilöllinen tentti).
workload.sv: Föreläsningar, vecko-övningar, online tent (grupp eller enskild).
workload.en: Lectures, exercises,  online exam (group or individual).

prerequisites.fi: Pakollinen: CHEM-A1410 Materiaalitieteen perusteetSuositeltu: CHEM-C2260 Atomirakenne ja spektroskopia JA PHYS-A2140 Aineen rakenne (CHEM) TAI CHEMA1240 Atomien ja molekyylien kvanttimekaniikka ja spektroskopia.
prerequisites.sv: Obligatorisk: CHEM-A1410 Grunder i MaterialvetenskapRekommenderad: CHEM-C2260 Atomstruktur och spektroskopi OCH PHYS-A2140 Materiens struktur (CHEM) ELLER CHEM-A1240 Kvantmekanik och spektroskopi av atomer och molekyler.
prerequisites.en: Compulsory: CHEM-A1410 Introduction to Materials ScienceRecommended: CHEM-C2260 Atomic Structure and Spectroscopy AND PHYS-A2140 Structure of Matter (CHEM) OR CHEM-A1240 Quantum Mechanics and Spectroscopy of Atoms and Molecules

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin jälkeen opiskelija osaa:
  • selittää sähköisten, optisten, termisten, dielektristen ja magneettisten ominaisuuksien teoreettisen taustan (kvanttimekaniikkaan perustuen)
  • laskea tärkeimpiä materiaaliominaisuuksia
learningOutcomes.sv:
Efter godkänd kurs bör studeranden kunna:
  • förklara elektroniska, optiska, termiska, dielektroniska och magnetiska egenskapers teoretiska bakgrund baserat på  kvantmekanik
  • räkna de viktigaste materialegenskaperna
learningOutcomes.en:
After the course the student will be able to:
  • explain the theoretical background of electrical, optical, thermal, dielectric and magnetic properties based on quantum mechanics
  • calculate the most important properties of materials

  • calculate the most important properties of materials

organizationName.en: Department of Chemistry and Materials Science

workload.fi:
5 op = 135 h
Kontaktiopetus:
- Luennot 20-28 h
- Laskuharjoitukset ja tietokoneharjoitukset 4-8 h
- Ryhmätyöhön liittyvä ohjeistus ja tulosten esittäminen 4-8 h
Itsenäinen työ (95-110h):
- Ryhmässä tehty projektityö (sisältää raportoinnin)
- Itsenäinen opiskelu (luentoihin ja tenttiin valmistautuminen, laskuharjoitukset ja mahd. kotitehtävät)
workload.sv:
5 sp = 135 h
Kontaktundervisning:
- Föreläsningar 20-28 h
- Räkneövningar och datorövningar 4-8 h
- Instruktioner till grupparbeten och presentation av grupparbeten 4-8 h
Självständigt arbete (95-110 h)
- Projektarbete i grupp (inklusive rapportering)
- Självständiga studier (förberedelse för föreläsningar och tentamen, räkneövningar och ev. hemuppgifter)
workload.en:
5 cr = 135 h
Contact teaching:
- Lectures 20-28 h
- Calculus and computer exercises 4-8 h
- Group work instructions and presentation of group work 4-8 h
Individual work (95-110 h):
- Project work in groups (including reporting)
- Individual studying (preparing for lectures and exams, calculus excersises and possible homework)

prerequisites.fi: Pakollinen: Laboratorioturvallisuuskurssi CHEM-A1010 tai CHEM-E0140.Pakollinen: CHEM-A1270 Yleinen kemia ja CHEM-A1280 Kemian peruslaboratoriotyöt TAI CHEM-A1200 Kemiallinen rakenne ja sitoutuminen TAI CHEM-C1220 Principles of General and Organic Chemistry ja CHEM-A1280.
prerequisites.sv: Obligatorisk: Kurs i laborationssäkerhet CHEM-A1010 eller CHEM-E0140.Obligatorisk: CHEM-A1270 Allmän kemi och CHEM-A1280 Grundläggande laboratoriearbeten i kemi ELLER CHEM-A1200 Kemisk struktur och bindning ELLER CHEM-C1220 Principles of General and Organic Chemistry och CHEM-A1280.
prerequisites.en: Compulsory: Laboratory safety course CHEM-A1010 or CHEM-E0140.Compulsory: CHEM-A1270 General Chemistry and CHEM-A1280 Basic Laboratory Work in Chemistry OR CHEM-A1200 Chemical Structure and Bonding OR CHEM-C1220 Principles of General and Organic Chemistry and CHEM-A1280.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin suoritettuaan opiskelija
- tuntee pintafaasin termodynamiikkaa, adsorption, eri rajapinnat (kiinteä-kaasu, neste-kaasu, kiinteä-neste, neste-neste), pinta-aktiiviset aineet, misellit, kolloidit ja emulsiot.
- ymmärtää mitkä pintaominaisuudet tai liuotinominaisuudet vaikuttavat kolloidien ja nanopartikkelidispersioiden stabiilisuuteen
- osaa kuvata mitkä ominaisuudet vaikuttavat vesiliukoisten polymeerien ja polyelektrolyyttien käyttäytymiseen liuoksessa ja adsorptioon
- tuntee pintakemiallisia ilmiöitä luonnossa ja teollisissa prosesseissa
- osaa työskennellä tarkasti ja turvallisesti laboratoriossa ja osaa käytännössä suorittaa pintakemiallisesti tärkeitä mittauksia, kuten kriittisen misellikonsentraation määritys, partikkelikoon määritys ja adsorption mittaaminen
- osaa työskennellä tehokkaasti ryhmässä ja esittää tuloksia visuaalisesti selkeällä tavalla
learningOutcomes.sv:
Efter godkänd kurs ska studenten
- kunna de viktigaste begreppen gällande gränsytors termodynamik, adsorption, olika gränsytor (fast-gas, fast- vätska, vätska-gas, vätska-vätska), ytaktiva ämnen, miceller, kolloider och emulsioner
- förstå vilka egenskaper hos gränsytor och lösningsmedel som påverkar stabiliteten hos kolloider och nanopartikeldispersioner
- kunna redogöra för vilka egenskaper som påverkar vattenlösliga polymerers och polyelektrolyters beteende i lösningar samt deras adsorption
- känna till ytkemiska fenomen i naturen och i industriella processer
- kunna arbeta noggrant och säkert i laboratoriet och i praktiken utföra ytkemiskt viktiga mätningar, såsom bestämning av kritisk micellkoncentration, bestämning av partikelstorlek och mätning av adsorption.
- kunna arbeta effektivt i grupp och presentera resultat på ett visuellt tydligt sätt
learningOutcomes.en:
After the course the student
- knows the thermodynamics of interfaces, adsorption, various interfaces (solid-gas, liquid-gas, solid-liquid, liquid-liquid), surfactants, micelles, colloids and emulsions.
- understands what surface and solvent properties affect the stability of colloids and nanoparticle dispersions
- is able to describe what properties affect the behavior of water soluble polymers and polyelectrolytes in solutions and their adsorption
- is familiar with surface chemical phenomena in nature and industrial processes
- is able to work safely in the laboratory and to measure important interfacial phenomena such as critical micelle concentration, particle size and adsorption
- can work effectively in groups and present results in a clear and logical way in visual form

content.fi: Pintakemian perusteet. Pinnan ja rajapinnan määritys. Adsorptio ja pintojen termodynamiikka. Pinta-aktiiviset aineet, pintajännitys ja emulsiot. Vesiliukoiset polymeerit ja polyelektrolyytit. Pintakemialliset ilmiöt luonnossa ja teollisissa prosesseissa.
content.sv: Grunderna i ytkemi. Definition av ytor och gränsytor. Adsorptionstermodynamik. Ytaktiva ämnen (tensider), ytspänning och emulsioner. Vattenlösliga polymerer och polyelektrolyter. Ytkemiska fenomen i naturen och i industriella processer.
content.en: Basics of surface chemistry. Definition of surface and interfaces. Adsorption and thermodynamics of surfaces. Surfactants, surface tension and emulsions. Water soluble polymers and polyelectrolytes. Surface chemical phenomena in nature and in industrial processes.

assesmentMethods.fi: Luennot, kotitehtävät, laskuharjoitukset, projektityö ja tentti. Kaikki osa-alueet vaikuttavat arvosanaan.
assesmentMethods.sv: Föreläsningar, hemuppgifter, räkneövningar, projektarbete och tentamen. Alla delområden påverkar vitsordet.
assesmentMethods.en: Lectures, homework, exercises, project work and exam. Everything will contribute to the final grade.

Jos toteutus perutaan, tulee opiskelijoille tarjota vaihtoehtoinen tapa suorittaa kurssi, tai ehdotus muusta soveltuvasta suoritettavasta kurssista.
additionalInformation.sv: Undervisningsspråket : finska Undervisningsperiod : 2022-2023 Vår IV - V  2023-2024 Vår IV - VKursens studiemoment kan ställas in ifall under fem studerande har anmält sig till studiemomentet i fråga. Om studiemomentet inte arrangeras i vanlig ordning, bör studerandena erbjudas ett alternativt sätt att avlägga kursen, eller erbjudas alternativ på andra lämpliga kurser att avlägga.

In the case of cancelled course implementations, the students enrolled to them must be provided with an alternative way of completing the course or be advised to take some other applicable course.

workload.fi:
5 op = 135 h
Kontaktiopetus:
- Luennot 20-28 h
- Laskuharjoitukset ja tietokoneharjoitukset 4-8 h
- Ryhmätyöhön liittyvä ohjeistus ja tulosten esittäminen 4-8 h
Itsenäinen työ (95-110h):
- Ryhmässä tehty projektityö (sisältää raportoinnin)
- Itsenäinen opiskelu (luentoihin ja tenttiin valmistautuminen, laskuharjoitukset ja mahd. kotitehtävät)
workload.sv:
5 sp = 135 h
Kontaktundervisning:
- Föreläsningar 20-28 h
- Räkneövningar och datorövningar 4-8 h
- Instruktioner till grupparbeten och presentation av grupparbeten 4-8 h
Självständigt arbete (95-110 h)
- Projektarbete i grupp (inklusive rapportering)
- Självständiga studier (förberedelse för föreläsningar och tentamen, räkneövningar och ev. hemuppgifter)
workload.en:
5 cr = 135 h
Contact teaching:
- Lectures 20-28 h
- Calculus and computer exercises 4-8 h
- Group work instructions and presentation of group work 4-8 h
Individual work (95-110 h):
- Project work in groups (including reporting)
- Individual studying (preparing for lectures and exams, calculus excersises and possible homework)

prerequisites.fi: Pakollinen: Laboratorioturvallisuuskurssi CHEM-A1010 tai CHEM-E0140.Pakollinen: CHEM-A1270 Yleinen kemia ja CHEM-A1280 Kemian peruslaboratoriotyöt TAI CHEM-A1200 Kemiallinen rakenne ja sitoutuminen TAI CHEM-C1220 Principles of General and Organic Chemistry ja CHEM-A1280.
prerequisites.sv: Obligatorisk: Kurs i laborationssäkerhet CHEM-A1010 eller CHEM-E0140.Obligatorisk: CHEM-A1270 Allmän kemi och CHEM-A1280 Grundläggande laboratoriearbeten i kemi ELLER CHEM-A1200 Kemisk struktur och bindning ELLER CHEM-C1220 Principles of General and Organic Chemistry och CHEM-A1280.
prerequisites.en: Compulsory: Laboratory safety course CHEM-A1010 or CHEM-E0140.Compulsory: CHEM-A1270 General Chemistry and CHEM-A1280 Basic Laboratory Work in Chemistry OR CHEM-A1200 Chemical Structure and Bonding OR CHEM-C1220 Principles of General and Organic Chemistry and CHEM-A1280.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin suoritettuaan opiskelija
- tuntee pintafaasin termodynamiikkaa, adsorption, eri rajapinnat (kiinteä-kaasu, neste-kaasu, kiinteä-neste, neste-neste), pinta-aktiiviset aineet, misellit, kolloidit ja emulsiot.
- ymmärtää mitkä pintaominaisuudet tai liuotinominaisuudet vaikuttavat kolloidien ja nanopartikkelidispersioiden stabiilisuuteen
- osaa kuvata mitkä ominaisuudet vaikuttavat vesiliukoisten polymeerien ja polyelektrolyyttien käyttäytymiseen liuoksessa ja adsorptioon
- tuntee pintakemiallisia ilmiöitä luonnossa ja teollisissa prosesseissa
- osaa työskennellä tarkasti ja turvallisesti laboratoriossa ja osaa käytännössä suorittaa pintakemiallisesti tärkeitä mittauksia, kuten kriittisen misellikonsentraation määritys, partikkelikoon määritys ja adsorption mittaaminen
- osaa työskennellä tehokkaasti ryhmässä ja esittää tuloksia visuaalisesti selkeällä tavalla
learningOutcomes.sv:
Efter godkänd kurs ska studenten
- kunna de viktigaste begreppen gällande gränsytors termodynamik, adsorption, olika gränsytor (fast-gas, fast- vätska, vätska-gas, vätska-vätska), ytaktiva ämnen, miceller, kolloider och emulsioner
- förstå vilka egenskaper hos gränsytor och lösningsmedel som påverkar stabiliteten hos kolloider och nanopartikeldispersioner
- kunna redogöra för vilka egenskaper som påverkar vattenlösliga polymerers och polyelektrolyters beteende i lösningar samt deras adsorption
- känna till ytkemiska fenomen i naturen och i industriella processer
- kunna arbeta noggrant och säkert i laboratoriet och i praktiken utföra ytkemiskt viktiga mätningar, såsom bestämning av kritisk micellkoncentration, bestämning av partikelstorlek och mätning av adsorption.
- kunna arbeta effektivt i grupp och presentera resultat på ett visuellt tydligt sätt
learningOutcomes.en:
After the course the student
- knows the thermodynamics of interfaces, adsorption, various interfaces (solid-gas, liquid-gas, solid-liquid, liquid-liquid), surfactants, micelles, colloids and emulsions.
- understands what surface and solvent properties affect the stability of colloids and nanoparticle dispersions
- is able to describe what properties affect the behavior of water soluble polymers and polyelectrolytes in solutions and their adsorption
- is familiar with surface chemical phenomena in nature and industrial processes
- is able to work safely in the laboratory and to measure important interfacial phenomena such as critical micelle concentration, particle size and adsorption
- can work effectively in groups and present results in a clear and logical way in visual form

content.fi: Pintakemian perusteet. Pinnan ja rajapinnan määritys. Adsorptio ja pintojen termodynamiikka. Pinta-aktiiviset aineet, pintajännitys ja emulsiot. Vesiliukoiset polymeerit ja polyelektrolyytit. Pintakemialliset ilmiöt luonnossa ja teollisissa prosesseissa.
content.sv: Grunderna i ytkemi. Definition av ytor och gränsytor. Adsorptionstermodynamik. Ytaktiva ämnen (tensider), ytspänning och emulsioner. Vattenlösliga polymerer och polyelektrolyter. Ytkemiska fenomen i naturen och i industriella processer.
content.en: Basics of surface chemistry. Definition of surface and interfaces. Adsorption and thermodynamics of surfaces. Surfactants, surface tension and emulsions. Water soluble polymers and polyelectrolytes. Surface chemical phenomena in nature and in industrial processes.

assesmentMethods.fi: Luennot, kotitehtävät, laskuharjoitukset, projektityö ja tentti. Kaikki osa-alueet vaikuttavat arvosanaan.
assesmentMethods.sv: Föreläsningar, hemuppgifter, räkneövningar, projektarbete och tentamen. Alla delområden påverkar vitsordet.
assesmentMethods.en: Lectures, homework, exercises, project work and exam. Everything will contribute to the final grade.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin suoritettuaan: Oppimistaitojen osalta opiskelija - Harjaantuu itsenäisempään työskentelyyn laboratoriossa ja oppii suunnittelemaan kemiallisia kokeita.
- syventää tieteellisen tekstin kirjoittamistaitojaan ja pystyy itsenäisesti tuottamaan sujuvan laboratorioraportin.
- oppii kriittisesti arvioimaan omia töitään.
Kemiallisen termodynamiikan osalta opiskelija
- syventää ymmärrystä termodynamiikan perussuureista, kuten työstä, lämmöstä, sisäenergiasta, entalpiasta, entropiasta, Gibbsin energiasta, aktiivisuudesta sekä tasapainosta ja oppii manipuloimaan näiden suureiden välisiä yhteyksiä konkreettisten ongelmien ratkomiseksi.
- pystyy soveltamaan termodynamiikan perussuureita ja termodynaamista taulukkotietoa käytännön laboratoriotyössä. - osaa määrittämään termodynamiikan perussuureita kokeellisesti.

content.fi: Termodynamiikan pääsäännöt ja keskeiset termodynaamiset suureet. Kemiallinen tasapainot ja entalpia.
content.sv: Termodynamikens huvudsatser och de grundläggande termodynamiska storheterna. Kemisk jämvikt och entalpi.
content.en: Laws of thermodynamics and the fundamental thermodynamic properties. Chemical equilibrium and enthalpy.

prerequisites.fi: Pakollinen: Laboratorioturvallisuuskurssi CHEM-A1010 tai CHEM-E0140.Pakollinen: CHEM-A1310 Biotieteen perusteet TAI CHEM-C1300 Fundamental Biosciences
prerequisites.sv: Obligatorisk: kurs i laborationssäkerhet CHEM-A1010 eller CHEM-E0140.Obligatorisk: CHEM-A1310 Grunder i biovetenskap ELLER CHEM-C1300 Fundamental Biosciences
prerequisites.en: Compulsory: Laboratory safety course CHEM-A1010 or CHEM-E0140.Compulsory: CHEM-A1310 Basics in Bioscience OR CHEM-C1300 Fundamental Biosciences

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin suoritettuaan, opiskelija osaa
  1. luokitella pro- ja eukaryoottisolujen fysiologisia, kemiallisia ja biologisia ominaisuuksia
  2. esittää rakenteiden ja toiminnan vuorovaikutuksia molekyylitasolla
  3. kuvailla geenien säätelymekanismeja, niiden vaikutuksia solujen fysiologiaan sekä genetiikan menetelmiä
  4. nimetä biologisen työskentelyn menetelmiä (mm. aseptinen työskentely) ja solujen kasvuun vaikuttavia tekijöitä
  5. kuvailla pro- ja eukaryoottisolujen mikrobifysiologian hyötykäyttöä
learningOutcomes.sv:
Efter kursen har den studerande kompentens att: 
  1. Klassificera pro- och eukaryoternas fysiologiska, kemiska och biologiska egenskaper
  2. Presentera växelverkan mellan struktur och funktion på molekylnivå
  3. Avbilda genernas regleringsmekanismer, tillverkan av dessa på cellernas fysiologi samt metoder inom genteknik
  4. Nämna biologiska arbetsmetoder (t.ex. aseptik) och faktorer som påverkar cellernas växt
  5. Avbilda utnyttjandet av cellfysiologi
learningOutcomes.en:
After completing the course the student will be able to:
1. Classify selected characteristics (physiological, chemical and biological) of pro- and eukaryotic cells2. Present interactions of structure and function at the molecular level3. Describe gene regulatory mechanisms, their influence on cell physiology, and methods in gene analysis4. Name working methods in biology (e.g. aseptic technique) and factors which influence growth of cells5. Describe industrial use and applications of cell physiology

content.fi:
Solu- ja molekyylibiologian peruskurssi, jossa keskitytään aiheisiin:
  1. Mikrobi- , kasvi- ja eläinsolujen solutason rakenteiden ja toiminnan vuorovaikutus
  2. Luokittelun perusteet toiminnallisista lähtökohdista, mm. solujen pääluokat
  3. Solutason geneettisen säätelyn periaatteet ja geenitekniikan työkalut
  4. Solujen kasvatus laboratoriossa ja eri tekijöiden vaikutukset kasvuun
  5. Solujen ja solutuotteiden hyötykäyttö
content.sv:
En grundkurs inom cell- och molekylbiologi som handlar om:
  1. Växelverkan inom struktur och funktion vid mikrob-, växt- och djurceller på cellnivå 
  2. Grunder  på  klassificering med utgångspunkt på funktionella egenskaper, t.om. huvudgren av celler
  3. Grunder  på  genetisk reglering på cellnivån och gentekniska arbetsmetoder
  4. Odling av celler i laboratoriet och påverkan av olika faktorer på växten
  5. Utnyttjande av celler och cellprodukter
content.en:
A basic course in cell and molecular biology with focus on:
1. Microbe, plant and animal cell structure and function2. Basics of classification with emphasis on function, e.g. major cell classes3. Genetic regulation at the level of the cell and methods in genetics4. Cultivation of cells in the laboratory and factors influencing cell growth5. Use of cells and products thereof in biotechnology

assesmentMethods.en: Grading is based on assignments and homework completed during the course and course examination.

Assignments (laboratory and/or other assignments, groups available also in English)

N.B.! The course cannot be completed by only taking an exam.

prerequisites.fi: Pakollinen: Laboratorioturvallisuuskurssi CHEM-A1010 tai CHEM-E0140.Pakollinen: CHEM-A1310 Biotieteen perusteet TAI CHEM-C1300 Fundamental Biosciences
prerequisites.sv: Obligatorisk: kurs i laborationssäkerhet CHEM-A1010 eller CHEM-E0140.Obligatorisk: CHEM-A1310 Grunder i biovetenskap ELLER CHEM-C1300 Fundamental Biosciences
prerequisites.en: Compulsory: Laboratory safety course CHEM-A1010 or CHEM-E0140.Compulsory: CHEM-A1310 Basics in Bioscience OR CHEM-C1300 Fundamental Biosciences

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin suoritettuaan, opiskelija osaa
  1. luokitella pro- ja eukaryoottisolujen fysiologisia, kemiallisia ja biologisia ominaisuuksia
  2. esittää rakenteiden ja toiminnan vuorovaikutuksia molekyylitasolla
  3. kuvailla geenien säätelymekanismeja, niiden vaikutuksia solujen fysiologiaan sekä genetiikan menetelmiä
  4. nimetä biologisen työskentelyn menetelmiä (mm. aseptinen työskentely) ja solujen kasvuun vaikuttavia tekijöitä
  5. kuvailla pro- ja eukaryoottisolujen mikrobifysiologian hyötykäyttöä
learningOutcomes.sv:
Efter kursen har den studerande kompentens att: 
  1. Klassificera pro- och eukaryoternas fysiologiska, kemiska och biologiska egenskaper
  2. Presentera växelverkan mellan struktur och funktion på molekylnivå
  3. Avbilda genernas regleringsmekanismer, tillverkan av dessa på cellernas fysiologi samt metoder inom genteknik
  4. Nämna biologiska arbetsmetoder (t.ex. aseptik) och faktorer som påverkar cellernas växt
  5. Avbilda utnyttjandet av cellfysiologi
learningOutcomes.en:
After completing the course the student will be able to:
1. Classify selected characteristics (physiological, chemical and biological) of pro- and eukaryotic cells2. Present interactions of structure and function at the molecular level3. Describe gene regulatory mechanisms, their influence on cell physiology, and methods in gene analysis4. Name working methods in biology (e.g. aseptic technique) and factors which influence growth of cells5. Describe industrial use and applications of cell physiology

content.fi:
Solu- ja molekyylibiologian peruskurssi, jossa keskitytään aiheisiin:
  1. Mikrobi- , kasvi- ja eläinsolujen solutason rakenteiden ja toiminnan vuorovaikutus
  2. Luokittelun perusteet toiminnallisista lähtökohdista, mm. solujen pääluokat
  3. Solutason geneettisen säätelyn periaatteet ja geenitekniikan työkalut
  4. Solujen kasvatus laboratoriossa ja eri tekijöiden vaikutukset kasvuun
  5. Solujen ja solutuotteiden hyötykäyttö
content.sv:
En grundkurs inom cell- och molekylbiologi som handlar om:
  1. Växelverkan inom struktur och funktion vid mikrob-, växt- och djurceller på cellnivå 
  2. Grunder  på  klassificering med utgångspunkt på funktionella egenskaper, t.om. huvudgren av celler
  3. Grunder  på  genetisk reglering på cellnivån och gentekniska arbetsmetoder
  4. Odling av celler i laboratoriet och påverkan av olika faktorer på växten
  5. Utnyttjande av celler och cellprodukter
content.en:
A basic course in cell and molecular biology with focus on:
1. Microbe, plant and animal cell structure and function2. Basics of classification with emphasis on function, e.g. major cell classes3. Genetic regulation at the level of the cell and methods in genetics4. Cultivation of cells in the laboratory and factors influencing cell growth5. Use of cells and products thereof in biotechnology

assesmentMethods.fi: Arvostelu perustuu opiskelijan kurssin aikana suorittamiin harjoitus- ja kotitehtäviin sekä tenttiin.
assesmentMethods.sv: Bedömningen är baserad på utförande av övningar, hemarbete och tentamen.
assesmentMethods.en: Grading is based on assignments and homework completed during the course and course examination.

learningOutcomes.fi: The course consists of three themes. Firstly the students will be introduced to aims and general goals of doctoral studies. Lectures will also include practical aspects such as writing papers as well as general topics on research, patenting, and experimental design. In a second part, presentation skills will be developed. Students will work in both small groups and present before larger audiences.  In the third part subjects such as researcher ethics, intellectual property rights, and research methods will be treated.

name.fi: Unit Operations in Paper and Board Finishing and Converting D, Luento-opetus
name.sv: Unit Operations in Paper and Board Finishing and Converting D, Föreläsning
name.en: Unit Operations in Paper and Board Finishing and Converting D, Lecture

workload.fi:
There are three exercises. The first exercise is a product analysis of a converted product. The second one aims to create a virtual multi-layer cartonboard structure with a maximized bending stiffness. The third exercise familiarizes the student with corrugated box strength calculation.
Literature and theoretical part: Two essays on selected topics (2x10 p) and oral end discussion (short exam) 20 p. Exercises: 3 x 20p.

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the course the student:
knows different unit operations in finishing and converting
understands how different materials are deformed in converting operations
understands how these material properties affect and influence converting operations and further on converted structure’s properties
is able to apply theoretical knowledge on material properties to calculate critical product properties

content.fi:
The purpose of the course is to introduce the student to the various unit operations in-line and after paper and board machine lines in surface treatment, finishing and converting of paper and board products. Converting operations include e.g. slitting, cutting, creasing, sheeting, gluing, embossing, impregnation, lamination barrier coating and treatment processes. effects and influence of these operations and treatments on the product quality parameters is discussed.
In addition, the basics of packaging technology and use of the converted materials in packaging is discussed. A variety of most common products are studied with particular attention to their properties and end-use.

prerequisites.fi: Recommended prerequisites: KE-31.4100 Basic Electrochemistry and KE-31.4110 Electrochemical Kinetics or CHEM-E4145 Electrochemistry, or equivalent

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the course the student will be able to
1. derive transport equations from the entropy production
2. solve the Nernst-Planck equation in several different cases
3. evaluate and solve transport problems on electrodes
4. solve transport problems in porous, ion exchange and liquid membranes

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the course, the students are able to, describe chemical pulping processes with emphasis on kraft pulping, 
describe in detail the most important pretreatment processes for the successful fractionation of lignocellulose biomass,
illustrate the transport phenomena underlying the pre-treatment processes,
explain the phenomena taking place during different biomass refining process steps based on the knowledge of the chemical reactions and the principles of reaction kinetics,
discuss the chemistry and technology of existing and novel fractionation processes and, based on this knowledge, formulate the principles of a forest biorefinery.
learningOutcomes.sv:
After the course, the students are able to,
describe chemical pulping processes with emphasis on kraft pulping, describe in detail the most important pretreatment processes for the successful fractionation of lignocellulose biomass,illustrate the transport phenomena underlying the pre-treatment processes,explain the phenomena taking place during different biomass refining process steps based on the knowledge of the chemical reactions and the principles of reaction kinetics,discuss the chemistry and technology of existing and novel fractionation processes and, based on this knowledge, formulate the principles of a forest biorefinery.
learningOutcomes.en:

content.fi: The course is focused on biomass fractionation via chemical processes. The most important technical pre-treatment methods will be presented and then the chemistry and technology of the most important fractionation methods is covered. The main emphasis is on kraft pulping, but also other fractionation methods are covered (e.g. acid sulfite and the most relevant organosolv fractionation methods). An integral part of this course are exercises, covering selected examples (e.g., heat transfer, reaction kinetics, diffusion in lignocellulose matrix).

An integral part of this course are exercises, covering selected examples (e.g., heat transfer, reaction kinetics, diffusion in lignocellulose matrix).
